name: Gabriel Engel
position: Founder of Rocket.Chat and GSoC 2023 Administrator
short_biography: Creating the platform for human collaboration over the Internet, powered by the global open source community.
long_biography: Gabriel Engel is the founder of Rocket.Chat. Rocket.Chat is the leading open source team collaboration platform that allows users to chat securely on the web, desktop, or mobile; featuring extensive interoperability options with most major open source and commercial messaging platforms. Gabriel started the Rocket.Chat project on Github in 2015 and is passionate about open source and emerging technologies that empowers humanity to better collaborate over the Internet. Over the past decade, he has successfully built a global company to sustainably fund and fuel the evolution of the open source mission.

name: Rodrigo Nascimento
short_biography: Creating the platform for human collaboration over the Internet, powered by the global open source community.
long_biography: Rodrigo co-founded the Rocket.Chat project in 2015 and is passionate about collaboration tools, programming, open source and new technology. Rodrigo is the primary architect for Rocket.Chat and has led and nurtured generations of open source contributors and developers in the past eight years.

name: Sing Li
short_biography: Creating the platform for human collaboration over the Internet, powered by the global open source community.
long_biography: Sing Li has over thirty years of working experience with open source projects and communities.  He totally believes that open source is the only viable way for mankind to collaborate and improve our way of life - independent of geopolitical and other artificial barriers or boundaries. As one of the earliest open source contributors to the Rocket.Chat project, he introduced Google Summer of Code and served as GSoC administrator for the past seven years.

name: Gabriel Casals
short_biography: Senior engineering manager with over 10 years of experience in leading remote teams and delivering innovative solutions.
long_biography: Gabriel Casals is a Senior Engineering Manager at Rocket.Chat and also a GSoC Administrator who knows how to turn ideas into reality. He has over 10 years of experience in working with projects of different sizes and scopes, both locally and globally, in various domains such as e-commerce, education, health, and finance. He is an expert in agile software development, scrum, and agile management, and has led remote teams using these methodologies. He is also an admirer of topics related to innovation, change management, and business strategy, and has shared his insights and knowledge through workshops and events.

name: Vinayak Sharma
short_biography: Hey there, I''m Vinayak Sharma—an aspiring web developer with a heart for all things open source, a soft spot for anime, and an unwavering love for everything tech.
long_biography: Hello, I''m Vinayak Sharma—a passionate 2nd-year undergraduate at AKGEC, Ghaziabad. Currently, I''m diving into the world of Open Source as a contributor to Rocket.Chat for GSoC''23. Beyond coding, you''ll find me collaborating with friends on personal projects, fueled by a love for community-driven creation. My driving force is an unwavering dedication to tackling challenges head-on. Let''s connect, innovate, and code a better future together.

name: Nabhag Motivaras
short_biography: I''m Nabhag, a final-year Computer Engineering student from India, driven by a deep passion for Engineering.
long_biography: Beyond my academics, I''m devoted to crafting Plugins and Integrations that seamlessly connect various products, resulting in substantial impacts. I''m an active Contributor in the Rocket.Chat Apps Community, and I firmly believe in transparently sharing my learning journey and progress. This involvement has opened doors to exciting opportunities, allowing me to shape platform integrations and extensions. Every Hackathon fuels my passion for designing innovative plugins, while my broader focus extends to creating developer tools and products that enhance the overall developer experience. Embracing the world of open source empowers me to work on projects close to my heart. While my primary identity revolves around being an OpenSource Contributor, I''ve also had the honor of taking part in Google Summer of Code, which has added another layer of enrichment to my journey.

name: Disha Bhardwaj
short_biography: Hello, I''m Disha Bhardwaj, hailing from the lively city of New Delhi, India. As a recent software development graduate, I''ve seamlessly transitioned from academia to the professional realm. My journey as a budding professional is defined by a passion for innovation and a determination to excel. I''m thrilled to leverage my skills and contribute meaningfully to the world of technology
long_biography: Hello, I''m Disha Bhardwaj, an inquisitive explorer in the world of technology. Recently, I shifted from being a student to entering the professional stage, marking an exciting phase in my journey. During my college years, I became captivated by web development, delving deep into this dynamic field. To enhance my skills, I took on significant hackathons, where I thrived under pressure and came up with innovative solutions in tight timeframes. Alongside this, hands-on internships provided me with valuable insights, bridging the gap between theory and real-world application. A unique aspect of my journey is my passion for trying out different tech stacks in web development. Experimenting with new tools and methods to create innovative solutions genuinely brings me joy. My professional adventure began at Lowe''s, where I serve as an Associate Software Developer. This role has allowed me to translate classroom learning into tangible real-world contributions. Collaborating within a dynamic team has sharpened my teamwork and problem-solving skills. My journey showcases the power of curiosity and commitment, illustrating the transformative influence of technology. As I move forward, I''m excited to explore new opportunities, drive innovation, and contribute to the ever-evolving world of technology

name: Vivek Srivastava
short_biography: My name is vivek Srivastava I am persuing my btech from Indian institute of information technology Guwahati I''m 2023 graduating student my Major is Electronics and communication Engineering. I have contributed in many open source projects. My project Under gsoc23 is Playground for UIKit ReactJS Components

name: Henit Chobisa
short_biography: Final Year Student at VIT, Vellore, GSOC''23 at Rocket.Chat, Former Junior Developer Evangelist at Apache Devlake and a Gitpod Hero
long_biography: I am Henit Chobisa, a final year student from VIT, Vellore, originally from Udaipur Rajasthan. I am a full stack developer proficient with next, node and golang and sidewise explored a lots of other app stacks as well such as swift, flutter, tauri, electron, spring boot etc. with popular databases such as postgres and mongodb. I have always been an open source fan and have been contributing to open source from an year, achieving a part of Google Summer of Code this year, former role of junior devrel at Apache Devlake and also own a title of Gitpod Hero (https://www.gitpod.io/community/heroes). Apart from tech, Idealising Steve Jobs, I have a deep interest in product research, marketing ideologies and public speaking

name: Aditya Singh
short_biography: A passionate pre-final year computer science and engineering student hailing from India. As a dedicated software engineer, I thrive on the art of problem-solving and innovation, I like to contribute to Open-Source and I''m committed to contributing my skills and knowledge to the community. With a strong foundation in computer science.
long_biography: Greetings, everyone! I am Aditya Singh, a highly motivated and aspiring computer science and engineering student in the penultimate year of my educational journey, proudly representing the diverse and dynamic nation of India. From a young age, I have been captivated by the boundless possibilities that the world of technology offers, propelling me on an unwavering path towards becoming a proficient software engineer. One of the defining aspects of my journey is my ardent dedication to the open-source ethos. The idea that technology should be a collaborative effort, freely accessible and modifiable by anyone, resonates deeply with me. I find immense satisfaction in actively participating in open-source projects, where innovation is born through collective intelligence. My contributions span a spectrum of domains, from enhancing the functionality of existing projects to spearheading the development of new tools that cater to real-world challenges. Being a software engineer isn''t just a career choice for me; it''s a way of life. The process of turning abstract concepts into tangible, functional systems is akin to crafting a masterpiece, where every line of code is a stroke of creativity. I believe that technology should be an enabler, solving real-world problems, fostering inclusivity, and enhancing the quality of life for individuals across the globe.

name: Vipin Chaudhary
short_biography: I''m Vipin Chaudhary, an aspiring developer and student based in India. Fueled by a love for community-driven creation, my tech journey is all about learning, growing, and making a difference.
long_biography: Currently a sophomore in college, I''m on a mission to dive deep into the world of technology. Inspired to be a great developer who''s up for challenges, I thrive on continuously improving my craft. My true calling is in leveraging the power of code to create meaningful solutions for the world.
